headline: Oracle (ORCL): Has the Recent Pullback Opened a Long-Term Value Opportunity?
summary: Oracle (ORCL) has quietly pulled back over the past month, even as its year to date and multi year returns remain strong. That combination makes the current setup interesting for long term investors. See our latest analysis for Oracle. The recent pullback, including a roughly 19 percent 30 day share price return, comes after a strong run. The year to date share price return remains solidly positive and multi year total shareholder return remains exceptional, signaling that momentum is cooling...

headline: Oracle (ORCL) Could Surge Higher as Analysts Highlight Major AI Growth Potential

headline: 3 Stocks Estimated To Be Trading Below Their Intrinsic Value
summary: As major U.S. stock indexes continue to rise, with the Dow Jones Industrial Average nearing a record high despite recent employment concerns, investors are actively seeking opportunities in an evolving market landscape. In this environment, identifying stocks that may be trading below their intrinsic value can offer potential for growth and stability amidst fluctuating economic indicators.

headline: Microsoft (NASDAQ: MSFT) Stock Price Prediction for 2025: Where Will It Be in 1 Year
summary: Shares of Microsoft (NASDAQ:MSFT) lost 1.58% over the past five trading sessions after losing 1.52% the five prior. headline: Traders Are Still Skeptical Of IBM Stock After 40% Run in 2025
summary: Shares of International Business Machines (NYSE: IBM) are up roughly 40% in 2025, yet retail traders on Reddit and X remain unconvinced. Current social sentiment sits at 48 out of 100, neutral territory, with recent readings dipping as low as 32. headline: Microsoft Stock Is An AI Winner, ‘Bubble or No Bubble.’ Here’s Why.
summary: Luria didn’t outright deny the existence of an AI bubble—but he didn’t come down on one side of the argument, either.  In any case, Microsoft offers “the best AI exposure, bubble or no bubble,” he wrote.  Luria struck an incrementally more negative tone regarding OpenAI, the private company often viewed as the poster child of the AI trade, which is so influential that major partners like  Oracle  are viewed as a proxy for it.

content.title: Microsoft Stock Is An AI Winner, ‘Bubble or No Bubble.’ Here’s Why.
content.summary: Luria didn’t outright deny the existence of an AI bubble—but he didn’t come down on one side of the argument, either.  In any case, Microsoft offers “the best AI exposure, bubble or no bubble,” he wrote.  Luria struck an incrementally more negative tone regarding OpenAI, the private company often viewed as the poster child of the AI trade, which is so influential that major partners like  Oracle  are viewed as a proxy for it.

headline: Why AI infrastructure is 'unprecedented' compared to cloud buildout
summary: Argent Capital Management Portfolio Manager Jed Ellerbroek sits down with Josh Lipton in the Market Domination studio to lay out why investors may be growing increasingly nervous about the buildout of AI infrastructure, especially in comparison to the amount of cloud buildout cycles and those demand figures. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination.
